activity_descriptions.group_watch: A watch for [duration] was set on the group: [group.title] ([group.id])
activity_descriptions.server_watch: A watch for [duration] was set on the server: [hostname]
activity_descriptions.peer_add: Master server added to the network: [host]
activity_descriptions.peer_disconnect: Master serfer disconnected from the network: [host]
activity_descriptions.peer_command: Control command [commands] sent to master server: [host]

plugin_type_descriptions.event: **Event Plugins** contain the code that runs your actual jobs.  They run on the target server for the event, and are expected to consume JSON on STDIN and output JSON on STDOUT, to communicate with xyOps regarding the job, and to denote the completion and status.  For more information see [Event Plugins](#Docs/plugins/event-plugins).
plugin_type_descriptions.monitor: **Monitor Plugins** run the specified code every minute on every targeted server to graph custom data.  For example, you can use this to monitor your own application status, and produce output that feeds multiple graphs.  For more information see [Monitor Plugins](#Docs/plugins/monitor-plugins).
plugin_type_descriptions.action: **Action Plugins** can run custom code in response to job conditions such as completion, success, error, and other cases.  The action code runs on the current master server, and is designed to call your own notification system.  For more information see [Action Plugins](#Docs/plugins/action-plugins).
plugin_type_descriptions.scheduler: **Trigger Plugins** allow you to define your own event scheduling systems.  Every minute, your plugin code will execute and be passed a JSON document containing all the events currently assigned, plus the date/time in the event's timezone, and you can decide which events run at which times.  For more information see [Trigger Plugins](#Docs/plugins/trigger-plugins).

error_type_descriptions.master: Unfortunately, you have landed on a non-primary master server.  Meaning, this server is part of a cluster of master servers, but it is not the current primary server.  The current primary server is "[masterHost]", but you may not be able to access it directly.  Multi-master setups typically have a load balancer in front, so you don't ever have to address any master server directly.  However, since you are here reading this, something has clearly gone wrong.  Please contact your system administrator for help.

workflow_controller_descriptions.multiplex: The **Multiplex** controller allows you to run an event job multiple times in parallel, across multiple servers.  Specifically, it will launch one parallel job for each configured target server in the event.  Make sure your event targets multiple servers, otherwise this will only launch a single job.
workflow_controller_descriptions.wait: The **Wait** controller waits for a specific amount of time before passing control to all the connected nodes.
workflow_controller_descriptions.repeat: The **Repeat** controller will run a job multiple times in series or in parallel, based on the configured limits on the event.  You can specify the exact number of iterations below.  This is useful for running the same job a set number of times.
workflow_controller_descriptions.split: The **Split** controller will run a job multiple times in series or in parallel, but it will split the input data into multiple chunks, and run each chunk in its own job.  This is useful for processing large datasets in parallel, such as splitting a large file into smaller parts.  Use the expression field to specify the input data to split, which should point to an array.
workflow_controller_descriptions.join: The **Join** controller will wait for multiple input jobs to complete, and then pass control to the next node, combining the results of the jobs.  This is useful for aggregating data from multiple sources, such as combining the results of multiple API calls into a single response.
workflow_controller_descriptions.decision: The **Decision** controller will evalulate a custom expression, and only pass control to the next node if the expression evaluates to true.  This is useful for conditional logic, such as only running a job if a certain condition is met.

d_nt_subject.label: Subject:
d_nt_subject.caption: Enter a subject line for the ticket (i.e. title, summary, etc.).

d_nt_type.label: Type:
d_nt_type.caption: Select a type for the new ticket.

d_nt_assignee.label: Assigned To:
d_nt_assignee.caption: Select the user responsible for executing the ticket.

d_nt_tags.label: Tags:
d_nt_tags.caption: Optionally select tags to apply to the ticket.

d_wf_id.label: Workflow ID:
d_wf_id.caption: This is a unique ID for the workflow, used by the API.  It cannot be changed.

d_wf_title.label: Workflow Title:
d_wf_title.caption: Enter the title of the workflow, for display purposes.

d_wf_enabled.label: Status:
d_wf_enabled.caption: Only enabled workflows can execute, including scheduled and manual runs.

d_wf_icon.label: Custom Icon:
d_wf_icon.caption: Optionally choose a custom icon for the workflow.

d_wf_cat.label: Category:
d_wf_cat.caption: Select a category for the workflow (this may limit the max concurrent jobs, etc.)

d_wf_user_fields.label: User Fields:
d_wf_user_fields.caption: Optionally define custom parameters to be collected when a user runs your workflow manually.

d_wf_res_limits.label: Resource Limits:
d_wf_res_limits.caption: Optionally select resource limits to assign to jobs.  These will override limits set at the category level.

d_wf_job_actions.label: Job Actions:
d_wf_job_actions.caption: Optionally select custom actions to perform for each job.  Actions may also be added at the category level.

d_wf_notes.label: Notes:
d_wf_notes.caption: Optionally enter notes for the event, which will be included in all email notifications.

d_ete_scope.label: Test Scope:
d_ete_scope.caption: Choose whether to test the selected node by itself, or the entire workflow from starting from the selected node.

d_ete_actions.label: Actions:
d_ete_actions.caption: Enable all actions for the test run (includes both workflow and individual node actions)

d_ete_limits.label: Limits:
d_ete_limits.caption: Enable all resource limits for the test run (includes both workflow and individual node limits).

d_ete_input.label: Data Input:
d_ete_input.caption: Optionally customize the JSON input data for the first job.  This is used to simulate data being passed in from a previous job.

d_ete_files.label: File Input:
d_ete_files.caption: Optionally upload and attach files to the job as inputs.

d_ete_params.label: Workflow Parameters:
d_ete_params.caption: Enter values for all the event-defined parameters here.

d_wfde_event.label: Event:
d_wfde_event.caption: Select the event to use for the workflow node.

d_wfde_targets.label: Targets:
d_wfde_targets.caption: Optionally override the targets for running the event.

d_wfde_algo.label: Algorithm:
d_wfde_algo.caption: Optionally override the target selection algorithm for the event.

d_wfde_user_params.label: User Parameters:
d_wfde_user_params.caption: Enter values for all the event-defined parameters here.

d_wfdj_plugin.label: Plugin:
d_wfdj_plugin.caption: Select the desired Plugin for the node.  Plugin parameters will appear below.

d_wfdj_title.label: Custom Title:
d_wfdj_title.caption: Optionally customize the title for the node (defaults to the Plugin name).

d_wfdj_icon.label: Custom Icon:
d_wfdj_icon.caption: Optionally choose a custom icon for the plugin node (defaults to the Plugin icon).

d_wfdj_cat.label: Category:
d_wfdj_cat.caption: Select a category for the plugin job (category limits and actions will apply).

d_wfdj_targets.label: Targets:
d_wfdj_targets.caption: Select groups and/or servers to run the plugin job.

d_wfdj_algo.label: Algorithm:
d_wfdj_algo.caption: Select the desired algorithm for choosing a server from the target list.

d_wfdj_user_params.label: Plugin Parameters:
d_wfdj_user_params.caption: Enter values for all the Plugin-defined parameters here.

d_wfd_type.label: Controller Type:
d_wfd_type.caption: Select the desired type for the controller.

d_wfd_stagger.label: Stagger Delay:
d_wfd_stagger.caption: Optionally enter a duration to stagger the start of each multiplexed job.

d_wfd_wait.label: Wait Delay:
d_wfd_wait.caption: Enter a duration to wait before control passes to the connected nodes.

d_wfd_repeat.label: Repeat Iterations:
d_wfd_repeat.caption: Enter the number of iterations to repeat before continuing on.

d_wfd_split.label: Split Expression:
d_wfd_split.caption: Specify the path to the array for splitting, using `dot.path.notation`.

d_wfd_if.label: Expression:
d_wfd_if.caption: Enter the expression to evaluate using `dot.path.notation`.  If true, control will pass onto the next node.

d_wfd_title.label: Custom Title:
d_wfd_title.caption: Optionally enter a custom title for the node.

d_wfd_icon.label: Custom Icon:
d_wfd_icon.caption: Optionally choose a custom icon for the node.

d_wfd_continue.label: Continue Percentage:
d_wfd_continue.caption: Enter the percentage of jobs that must complete successfully before continuing on to the next node.

d_ex_job.label: Select Previous Job:
d_ex_job.caption: Select a completed job to explore its data.

d_ex_tree_viewer.label: Data Explorer:
d_ex_tree_viewer.caption: Click on the desired key to insert the full path into the field below.

d_ex_exp.label: Data Path:
d_ex_exp.caption: Once clicked, your selected data path will appear here.

d_ex_code_viewer.label: Job Data Viewer:
d_ex_code_viewer.caption: View the output data and/or files produced by the selected job.

d_ex_server.label: Select Server:
d_ex_server.caption: Select a server to load its data.

d_sys_sat_targets.label: Upgrade Targets:
d_sys_sat_targets.caption: Select which groups and/or servers you want to upgrade.

d_sys_sat_release.label: Satellite Version:
d_sys_sat_release.caption: Select the desired xyOps Satellite version to be installed.

d_sys_sat_stagger.label: Stagger Installs:
d_sys_sat_stagger.caption: Optionally stagger the installs by a custom interval.

d_sys_multi_targets.label: Upgrade Masters:
d_sys_multi_targets.caption: Select which master servers you want to upgrade.

d_sys_multi_release.label: xyOps Version:
d_sys_multi_release.caption: Select the desired xyOps version to be installed.

d_sys_multi_stagger.label: Stagger Installs:
d_sys_multi_stagger.caption: Optionally stagger the installs by a custom interval.

d_nt_subject.label: Subject:
d_nt_subject.caption: Enter a subject line for the ticket (i.e. title, summary, etc.).

d_nt_body.label: Body:
d_nt_body.caption: Enter the ticket body text using [GitHub Flavored Markdown](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/) syntax.

d_nt_type.label: Type:
d_nt_type.caption: Select a type for the new ticket.

d_nt_status.label: Status:
d_nt_status.caption: Select a status for the new ticket.

d_nt_category.label: Category:
d_nt_category.caption: Optionally assign the ticket to a category.

d_nt_assignee.label: Assigned To:
d_nt_assignee.caption: Select the user responsible for executing the ticket.

d_nt_cc.label: Cc:
d_nt_cc.caption: Optionally select users to receive updates for the ticket.

d_nt_notify.label: Notify:
d_nt_notify.caption: Optionally add custom e-mail addresses to receive updates for the ticket.

fe_nt_notify.title: Add new recipient
fe_nt_notify.description: Enter any email address to receive ticket updates.

d_nt_due.label: Due Date:
d_nt_due.caption: Optionally select the ticket due date (reminders are sent out after this).

d_nt_tags.label: Tags:
d_nt_tags.caption: Optionally select tags to apply to the ticket.

d_td_event.label: Event:
d_td_event.caption: Select the event for the ticket.

d_td_targets.label: Targets:
d_td_targets.caption: Optionally override the targets for running the event.

d_td_algo.label: Algorithm:
d_td_algo.caption: Optionally override the target selection algorithm for the event.

d_td_user_params.label: User Parameters:
d_td_user_params.caption: Enter values for all the event-defined parameters here.

errors.fe_wfd_split: Please enter a path to the array data you want to split on.
errors.fe_wfd_if: Please enter an expression to evaluate.
errors.ex_tree_no_data: The selected job produced no output data or files.
errors.new_wf_no_cats: You must define at least one category to add workflows.
errors.new_wf_no_plugins: You must define at least one plugin to add workflows.
errors.new_wf_no_groups: You must define at least one server group to add workflows.
errors.wfde_no_events: Please create at least one event before adding a workflow event node.
errors.wfde_event_not_found: Event ID "[node.data.event]" could not be found.
errors.wfdj_no_cats: You must define at least one category to add workflow plugin nodes.
errors.wfdj_no_plugins: You must create at least one Plugin to add workflow plugin nodes.
errors.wfdj_plugin_not_found: Plugin ID "[node.data.plugin]" could not be found.
errors.fe_wfdj_targets: You must select at least one target for the plugin job.
errors.fe_wf_title: Please enter a title for the workflow.
errors.wf_test_no_limit: Limit nodes cannot be tested directly.  Please select the attached event or plugin node instead.
errors.sde_no_servers: No active or recent servers found.  Please add a server to your cluster and try again.
errors.ticket_event_not_found: Event ID "[event.id]" could not be found.

intros.wfd_exp_builder: This allows you to explore output data from recently completed jobs, and pick out a specific JSON key path to use for your controller expression.
intros.wfd_data_explorer: Select a previously completed job to import the data and/or files from it.  This is so you can use it as simulated input for your test run.
intros.server_data_explorer: This allows you to explore monitoring data from your servers, and pick out a specific JSON key path to use for your expression.
intros.job_create_ticket: Use this form to create a new ticket, which will reference the current job.
intros.job_add_to_ticket: Attach the current job to an existing ticket.
intros.alert_create_ticket: Use this form to create a new ticket, which will reference the current alert.
intros.alert_add_to_ticket: Attach the current alert to an existing ticket.

messages.job_aborted: The job abort request was sent successfully.
messages.rollback_draft: Revision [event.revision] has been loaded as a draft edit.  Click 'Save Changes' to complete the rollback.  Note that a new revision number will be assigned.
messages.draft_restored: Your previous unsaved edits were restored.  Click the 'Cancel' button to discard them.
messages.wf_new_save: The new workflow was created successfully.
messages.secret_decrypted: The secret was successfully decrypted for editing.
